intro: Swertia scottii, commonly known as the Scottish swertia, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stem and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Swertia scottii is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
